intro: Patania triangularis, commonly known as the triangular patania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
